-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Joe Lewels was a good friend of John Mack [RIP]. It is a little known fact 
that Mack was an acid-head and shared these shamanarchistic influences with 
Lewels [albeit theoretically]. It looks to me as if Mack also had exposure to 
the voluminous work of one Terence McKenna. Terence [also RIP] has a grasp on 
the alien issue that most UFOlogists will never come close to. 
Mainstream Ufology is flawed in so far as it likes to seperate itself from the 
knowledge we&#039;ve gained from shamanic cultures and psychedelic spaces. It&#039;s my 
view that we will never fully comprehend just what&#039;s going on in this field 
*without* at least admitting that the use of entheogens has a historic and 
cultural role here.

This conference presentation is by the author of &#039;The God Hypothesis&#039;. Lewels 
covers much of the more recent work [unfinished] by John Mack on the role of 
psychedelics, amazon tribes, DNA and the much ignored reptilian angle. We also 
find much of this talk comes close to that of Jeremy Narby -  author and 
ethnopsychoanthropologist who wrote "The Cosmic Serpent, DNA and the Origins of 
Knowledge".

Watch out for the upcoming video by contributing media generators at 
exopolitics uk - "Saucer School - Why Alien Intelligences are re-booting 
Terrestrial Language Systems". If you can input to this in any way -  get in
